Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 2  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 2  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 57 of the TATA IPL 2025 sets the stage for a dramatic showdown at the iconic Eden Gardens as Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) take on Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in a clash of survival versus pride. For KKR, this is a must-win encounter to keep their playoff hopes alive, while CSK, already eliminated from contention, will look to play spoilsport and end their campaign on a high.


KKR enters this contest with everything to fight for. A win here would significantly improve their position on the points table and keep them in the playoff race. They've shown flair in the powerplay this season, scoring at a rate of 9.8 runs per over—the third-best in the tournament. This aggressive approach at the top has laid solid foundations, something they’ll aim to replicate in this high-pressure encounter.


CSK, on the other hand, have had a disappointing season by their standards. With nothing left to lose, they’ll be playing for pride and legacy. The five-time champions have struggled especially during the powerplay, posting the lowest scoring rate of all teams at just 8.1 runs per over. Their struggles have continued into the middle overs as well, where they, along with KKR, are the only two sides averaging less than 8 runs per over.

Despite their current form, both teams share a rich history in the IPL, having delivered some of the tournament’s most memorable matches. With contrasting motivations—KKR eyeing survival and CSK playing with freedom—this encounter promises intensity, emotion, and high-quality cricket.


Can KKR rise under pressure and keep their playoff dreams alive, or will CSK's fearless approach spoil the party? With Eden Gardens buzzing and the stakes high, Match 57 could be one of the most gripping contests of the season.



IPL Stats at Eden Gardens in 2025:


Pitch Report (Deep Dasgupta & Aaron Finch):
It's the last league game in Kolkata. It's a bit muggy but breezy as well. The pitch being used tonight is right at the center of the square. The boundary to the right is 62 meters, to the left it's 64 meters, and straight down it's 75 meters. This pitch looks a bit tacky and slightly patchy, with some loose areas that suggest there might be inconsistent pace and possibly some turn later in the game. Even though the surface looks a bit up and down, this has been a high-scoring venue, with an average score of 200. The new ball will be crucial—teams will need to make the most of the powerplay to set a strong platform. Interestingly, four of the five finished games here have been won by the team batting first. With quality spinners in both teams, putting runs on the board early could be key. Despite the surface's unpredictable nature, 200 is still an achievable total, and teams might lean toward batting first to take advantage of early scoring opportunities and then let the spinners exploit conditions later in the innings.

Death Overs (Overs 16-20)
KKR:- 55/2 (11 rpo, 5x4, 3x6) || CSK:- 40/2 in 4.4 overs (8.57 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)
 

In Match 57 of the TATA IPL 2025 at Eden Gardens, Chennai Super Kings edged past Kolkata Knight Riders by 2 wickets in a last-over thriller. In a match filled with momentum shifts, it was CSK’s composure and firepower under pressure that made the difference.

Batting first, KKR posted a competitive 179/6. Ajinkya Rahane played a captain’s knock of 48 off 33 balls, supported by Andre Russell’s blistering 38 off 21. Manish Pandey chipped in with an unbeaten 36, while Narine and Gurbaz provided quick starts. For CSK, Noor Ahmad was the pick of the bowlers, scalping 4 for 31 and pegging KKR back in the middle overs.

CSK’s chase began on a shaky note with two early wickets. But debutant Urvil Patel announced his arrival in style, hammering a scintillating 31 off just 11 deliveries, including four massive sixes. His counterattack shifted the pressure back onto KKR. Dewald Brevis then took charge with a fiery 52 off 25, while Shivam Dube added a steady 45.

As the match tightened, CSK needed 8 runs off the final over. MS Dhoni, ever the finisher, smashed a vintage six over long-on on the first ball, tilting the match CSK's way. After a minor hiccup, young Anshul Kamboj calmly struck the winning boundary to seal the chase with two balls to spare.





Ajinkya Rahane (Kolkata Knight Riders Captain):
"I think it was a real tough thing to be on the losing side. I think we were 10-15 runs short. The bowlers bowled really well. It was a great game but tough to be on the losing side. Absolutely. This format, that is bound to happen. One over here and there and it changes the game. Dube and Brevis played well. They took their chances and it paid off. It's about being brave. No complaints. The bowlers tried their best. We will try to win two in two and that will take us to 15. Let's see where we go from there."

MS Dhoni (Chennai Super Kings Captain):
"It's good to be on the winning side, you know. We got a lot of things correct tonight and I can obviously get emotional about it because of the pride factor. I felt that what was important is that we wanted to be practical about it. We wanted to fill in the 25 players in the squad. We want to be more competitive but also want to look into the next year. We also want to look into the right combinations, which bowler can bowl which overs according to the conditions. The batting order was not right earlier but now the intent is really good in the batters. You know the thing is, these are the players who are part of our squad right now. You may see them in the nets, you may see them in the practice games but nothing in the match. You need to give them opportunities and that's what counts."

Noor Ahmad (Player of the Match):
"I think it was a super win. Really happy with the win. Also, happy with my bowling. Brevis played really well and got us that win in the end. I didn't keep my focus on becoming the top wicket-taker. I just want to keep contributing to the team's win. I think the nick from Raghuvanshi — I enjoyed that wicket the most. I just try to use the length well and that's what's working for me right now."

Matchsummary.Commentss: Gujarat Titans Won by 3  Wickets  (D/L Method)

Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Gujarat Titans Won by 3  Wickets  (D/L Method)
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 56 of the TATA IPL 2025 promises a blockbuster clash as two top-performing sides—Mumbai Indians and Gujarat Titans—lock horns at the iconic Wankhede Stadium. Both teams have secured seven wins so far and are separated only by Net Run Rate, making this a virtual shootout for a top-two spot on the table.


Gujarat Titans have been the model of consistency this season, maintaining a settled top order that has delivered game after game. The trio of Sai Sudharsan, Shubman Gill, and Jos Buttler has formed the most successful top order of the tournament, collectively scoring 1,439 runs at an average of over 57 and a strike rate above 161. Remarkably, Gujarat remains the only team to have used the same three batters at the top in every game, underlining their clarity and cohesion. On the bowling front, Prasidh Krishna has been exceptional, leading the wicket charts with 19 scalps and proudly wearing the purple cap.


Mumbai Indians, after a shaky start, have bounced back in dominant fashion with six straight wins. Their revival has been led by the sensational form of Suryakumar Yadav, who has amassed 475 runs at an average of over 67 and a strike rate exceeding 172. What’s more impressive is his consistency—he has crossed the 25-run mark in every match he has played this season. Supporting him with the ball is Trent Boult, who has claimed 16 wickets and been lethal with the new ball.


With both sides in red-hot form and playoffs in sight, this clash could go a long way in shaping the final standings. The momentum-driven Mumbai face the ever-consistent Gujarat, and with stars on both sides, it promises to be a thrilling contest at the Wankhede.



IPL Stats at Wankhede Stadium in 2025:


Pitch Report- Ian Bishop and Matthew Hayden
This is a high-level clash here at the Wankhede Stadium. We are standing on pitch number 8. It's very very humid. Talking about the dimensions, it's 66 meters to the right, 5 meters shorter to the left, and 74 meters down the ground. There have been three games already on this surface. There has been a bit of weather around over the past few days, but today it’s been quite hot and sunny. RCB posted a big total when they played here, while CSK couldn’t post much. This wicket looks like a 200-plus surface. There may be a few showers tonight, so teams will probably look to chase. We also need to see whether there is any dew formation because both sides are high-powered batting units. For the bowlers, they'll need to be sharp and hope to come into the game early.

Death Overs (Overs 16-20)

In a rain-hit last-over thriller at the Wankhede Stadium, Gujarat Titans edged past Mumbai Indians by 3 wickets in Match 56 of the TATA IPL 2025. With this clutch win, GT climbed to the top of the points table, showcasing nerves of steel under pressure.

Mumbai Indians, asked to bat first, managed 155/8 in their 20 overs. Will Jacks top-scored with a fluent 53 off 35 balls, supported by Suryakumar Yadav’s 35 off 24. But frequent wickets stalled their momentum—Rohit Sharma scored just 7, and captain Hardik Pandya made only 1. Corbin Bosch’s late 27 gave MI a slight push. Gujarat’s bowling was disciplined, with Sai Kishore (2/34), Rashid Khan (1/21), and Prasidh Krishna (1/37) doing the damage.

Chasing the target, Gujarat lost Sai Sudharsan early for 5. Jos Buttler added 30, while skipper Shubman Gill anchored the innings with 43 off 46 balls. The chase was disrupted by rain multiple times, and after 18 overs were completed, the target was revised via the DLS method to 147 off 19 overs.

Needing 15 runs off the final over, Deepak Chahar began well, but a no-ball on the fourth delivery changed the momentum. Rahul Tewatia kept calm, scoring a crucial unbeaten 11 off 8 balls. He, alongside Arshad Khan, guided GT home off the very last ball of the match.

Hardik Pandya (Mumbai Indians Captain):
"Yes, definitely it's a tough way to go down. I think we fought really well with the total we had on the board. Most of the time we were out of the game but as a group, we kept pushing. It was a game of fine margins. It was definitely not a 150 wicket. We were short by 20-25 runs, maybe even 30 if we had batted better. Credit to the bowlers, they bowled in the right areas and kept fighting. I won’t say catches cost us the game; we were clinical in the field. I’d rather say the no-balls—my no-balls and even the last one. In my eyes, in T20s, it's a crime. It definitely hurt us today. Still, I’m really happy that everyone gave their 120% and fought hard. In the first half of the second innings, the ground wasn’t that wet, but later the ball kept getting wetter. The rain didn’t help—it’s not ideal to have so many stoppages. But at the end, we had to play, and we did."
 

Shubman Gill (Gujarat Titans Captain & Player of the Match):
"Definitely. There was a bit of chaos when we came out to bat after the break, but it's great to get the win. The game plan changed during the powerplay with the rain—honestly, it felt like a Test match at times. We decided to play normal cricket, but with the interruptions, it wasn’t easy to maintain rhythm.

The wicket was a bit slow, so hitting through the line wasn’t straightforward. It was challenging overall. There were a lot of emotions—mostly frustration—because we were ahead at one stage, but then we lost four wickets quickly. Again, it felt more like a Test match out there.

In games like this, where you're chasing 150 and it goes down to the last ball, every contribution matters. Small things in the field really count. These tight wins push you forward in a tournament like the IPL.

It's not easy for Rashid to return from injury, but he's putting in the hard work. His performance today was a really good sign. As a team, we’re taking it one game at a time. We're not thinking about standings or top-four just yet—we're focused on building into a strong unit for the long run."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 55 of the TATA IPL 2025 brings a high-stakes battle as Sunrisers Hyderabad take on Delhi Capitals in what could be a defining clash for both teams' playoff aspirations. The stakes are higher for Hyderabad, who not only need to win this match but also must triumph in their remaining fixtures and hope for favorable outcomes in other matches to keep their slim hopes alive. For Delhi, the equation is simpler—win, and their playoff chances receive a major boost.

Sunrisers Hyderabad have had a tough run this season, with only three wins to show from ten games. Two of those victories came at home, offering a glimmer of confidence as they return to familiar territory. However, their inconsistency and recent loss to Gujarat Titans have left them languishing in ninth place. Players like Heinrich Klaasen and Abhishek Sharma have shown flashes of brilliance but haven’t been enough to turn the season around.

Delhi Capitals, currently fifth on the table with six wins, are in a precarious yet stronger position. They started the season with four wins in their first four games but have since lost four out of their last six, including a recent defeat that has put pressure back on them. Led by Axar Patel, and with experienced players like Faf du Plessis and Kuldeep Yadav in the ranks, DC have the firepower to dominate.

With both sides entering off defeats and everything to play for, this contest promises to be a high-voltage thriller.



IPL Stats at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in 2025:

 
 

Pitch Report – WV Raman & Shane Watson:
"The longest boundary is straight down the ground at 76 meters, with square boundaries of 66 meters on either side. It's a red soil surface, so expect a bit of pace and bounce, and maybe some turn too.There's no grass on this pitch—it's dry but hard, which means the ball should carry through well. In the last game here, SRH scored 190 but LSG chased it down inside 16 overs. That tells you it’s a good wicket for batting.It might not assist the spinners too much, but the ball will come onto the bat nicely. The average first-innings score here has been over 200. So, expect plenty of runs again.Interestingly, SRH have won just 2 of their 5 matches at this venue in Hyderabad."

After a shaky start, Delhi Capitals managed to reach 133/7, thanks to a fighting partnership between Tristan Stubbs (41)* and Ashutosh Sharma (41). Pat Cummins was the chief destroyer with 3 wickets, ripping through the top order in a sensational opening burst.

Just as the teams were gearing up for the chase, rain swept through the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, forcing the players off the field. Despite waiting and multiple inspections, the rain refused to relent.

Eventually, the umpires had no choice but to call off the match, and both teams were awarded a point each. A frustrating end for Sunrisers Hyderabad who were on top, and a relief for Delhi Capitals, who were staring at defeat.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to Match 54 of the TATA IPL 2025, coming to you from the breathtaking heights of Dharamsala—hosting its first clash of the season! It’s the Punjab Kings  taking on the Lucknow Super Giants  in a very important game for both playoff hopefuls. Punjab enter the contest with their tails up after pulling off a stunning run chase in Chennai, while Lucknow find themselves in must-win territory, having stumbled in three of their last four games. With the mountain air charged with anticipation, will the Kings keep climbing, or can the Super Giants halt the slide and rise again? Grab your popcorn, this one’s a pressure cooker!

 

VENUE STATS:

Teams have opted to chase in all the 4 matches played at this ground since 2023, but the teams batting first have won 3 of those games. The average 1st innings score here since 2023 is 201, with the last game played here in IPL 2024 saw RCB post a mammoth 241 on board.


PITCH REPORT | Aaron Finch:

"We’ve got 62 meters on one side and 68 meters on the other — definitely not a big ground. The average total in evening matches here is over 200, so expect a high-scoring contest. The pitch has been under covers for a couple of days and shows some variation in colour, with patches that look noticeably abrasive. And with cloud cover around, dew is unlikely to be a major factor. That means bowlers — especially the spinners — will have just enough assistance to stay in the game."

 

TOSS:

Rishabh Pant has called it right at the toss and Lucknow will field first!

Updates ?? https://t.co/YuAePC273s#TATAIPL | #PBKSvLSG | @ShreyasIyer15 | @RishabhPant17 pic.twitter.com/743FmfoaSL

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 4, 2025
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6)
PBKS:- 66/2 (11 rpo, 4x4, 6x6) || LSG:- 38/3 (6.33 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15)
PBKS:- 95/1 (10.55 rpo, 4x4, 5x6) || LSG:- 105/2 (11.67 rpo, 8x4, 6x6)

 

Death Overs (Overs 16-20)
PBKS:- 75/2 (15 rpo, 9x4, 5x6) || LSG:- 56/2 (11.2 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)
 

In Match 54 of the TATA IPL 2025, Punjab Kings (PBKS) registered a commanding 37-run victory over Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala. After being put into bat first, PBKS posted a formidable total of 236 for 5 in their allotted 20 overs. Prabhsimran Singh led the charge with a scintillating 91 off 48 balls, including six fours and seven sixes. Captain Shreyas Iyer contributed a brisk 45, while Josh Inglis and Shashank Singh added valuable runs to bolster the innings. For LSG, Digvesh Singh Rathi was the standout bowler, claiming two wickets.

In response, LSG's chase faltered early, with Arshdeep Singh dismantling the top order by removing Mitchell Marsh, Aiden Markram, and Nicholas Pooran in quick succession. Despite a resilient 74 off 40 balls from Ayush Badoni and a rapid 45 from Abdul Samad, LSG managed 199 for 7, falling short of the target. Azmatullah Omarzai and Yuzvendra Chahal also made significant contributions with the ball, each taking crucial wickets.

This victory propels PBKS to second place on the points table, enhancing their playoff prospects, while LSG faces increased pressure to secure wins in their remaining matches to stay in contention.
 

Rishabh Pant (Lucknow Super Giants Captain):
"Conceding that many runs really hurt us. Dropping crucial catches at key moments cost us badly. We expected more assistance from the surface, but we didn’t read the lengths early on, and that set us back. That’s how the game goes sometimes. The dream is still alive. If we can win our next three games, we can turn things around. When the top order is in form, it makes sense they get more time. But we can’t expect them to do all the heavy lifting every time. We must learn to take the game deep as a unit."

 

Shreyas Iyer (Punjab Kings Captain):
"We're elated. Everyone stepped up at the right time and contributed brilliantly. Prabh’s performance today was outstanding—every shot he played was a delight to watch. Honestly, I’m glad I wasn’t aware of the records or milestones—I just focused on winning the match, and I’m proud we got the job done. We've had a bit of luck, but that luck has come from the hard work being put in behind the scenes. Yes, the execution from everyone today was top-notch. The only area where we still need to improve is fielding awareness and movement—we need to tighten up there. Going forward, it’s all about backing ourselves and playing with a positive mindset. For us, the result that matters is winning."
 

Prabhsimran Singh (Player of the Match):
"Thank you, sir—appreciate it.

This was a special knock for me, but more importantly, those two points mean a lot to the team. I’m glad I could contribute in a winning cause. After the dropped catch, I was already in and had scored 20–25 runs. I knew I had to capitalise on that chance and make it count. We took our time to assess the pitch, and once we understood it, we knew a score above 200 was par. We’re all playing according to the demands of the situation. If you look at our batting unit, everyone adjusts accordingly. And thankfully, in each game, one or two of us steps up to deliver."

Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 1  Run
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to Match 53 of the TATA IPL 2025, coming to you live from the electrifying Eden Gardens in Kolkata! It's the Kolkata Knight Riders  locking horns with the Rajasthan Royals  in what could be a playoff-defining contest. KKR, the reigning champions, are riding high after a commanding win over Delhi and are back in their fortress for a crucial two-game stretch that could cement their top-four status. Meanwhile, the Royals—officially out of playoff contention—have nothing to lose and everything to spoil. Will Rajasthan play party poopers, or will Kolkata rise once again in front of their roaring home crowd? Strap in, it's going to be an evening of fire and fight!

 

VENUE STATS:

The teams winning the toss have opted to field in 10 of the 12 games played at this venue since 2024, and the pacers have picked up 65% of the wickets. Previously this season, Lucknow had pipped Kolkata by 4 runs in the afternoon game played here, where over 450 runs were scored in the game. Will we see another high-scoring thriller today?

 

PITCH REPORT | Deep Das Gupta & Eoin Morgan:

“The dimensions, 66 meters on one side, 60 on the other, and 74 down the ground. Visually, you notice dry patches despite a grass covering most of it is dead. The big challenge for the ground staff would’ve been retaining moisture. Though it looks dry and dark, the surface is still holding together well. Unlike those classic ‘jigsaw puzzle’ Eden tracks that break up, this one seems solid. Might slow a bit early on and aid spinners, but overall a good batting wicket. Since sunsets are early here, chasing would be the preferred option as batting could get easier in the second innings.”

 

TOSS:

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 4, 2025
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6)
KKR:- 56/1 (9.33 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || RR:- 59/2 (9.83 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15)
KKR:- 67/2 (7.44 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || RR:- 96/3 (10.67 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)


Death Overs (Overs 16-20)
KKR:- 83/1 (16.6 rpo, 6x4, 8x6) || RR:- 50/3 (10 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

 

At a jam-packed Eden Gardens, Kolkata Knight Riders survived a Riyan Parag storm to defeat Rajasthan Royals by just 1 run in one of the most thrilling games of IPL 2025! After winning the toss and batting first, the Knight Riders rode on Andre Russell’s unbeaten 57 off just 25 balls, decorated with 6 towering sixes, to post a formidable 206/4 on board. Angkrish Raghuvanshi impressed again with a fluent 44, while skipper Ajinkya Rahane anchored with a composed 30.

In reply in the chase, RR lost early wickets, slumping to 71/5 inside 8 overs, credit to the KKR spinners — Varun Chakravarthy (2/32) and Moeen Ali (2/43). But Riyan Parag, playing a captain’s knock, lit up Eden with a sensational 95 off 45 balls, smacking 6 fours and 8 sixes and despite a spirited effort from Shubham Dubey in the end KKR held their nerve to seal a nail-biting victory to boost their position on the table.

 

Riyan Parag, Rajasthan Royals Skipper: "I had planned to stay until the final two overs, but unfortunately, I got out in the 18th. Looking back, we could have explored better bowling options in the last six overs. There's no one to blame but ourselves; we should have closed the game. We weren’t clinical enough on the field, and we’re facing the consequences now."

 

Ajinkya Rahane, Kolkata Knight Riders Skipper: "It was a really close game, but I’m very happy. Winning by just one or two runs gives you a special kind of satisfaction. Gurbaz and Angkrish batted brilliantly, and that finishing touch from Russell was outstanding. The plan was to go hard in the powerplay and then stabilise the innings until around the 12th over. It’s never easy for a new batter coming in, so Angkrish and I kept communicating to take it deep. Fielding plays a huge role—saving 10 to 12 runs can make a big difference. A couple of good catches or a run-out can completely change the game."

 

Andre Russell is the Player of the Match

Andre Russell: "We all knew how important this game was. With four matches left, it felt like we were playing four finals. I'm really happy with our performance and getting the win tonight. I wasn’t too concerned about the dot balls early on because I knew I had time. It was a tough wicket to walk in and start hitting from ball one, but I’m glad I was able to find some boundaries at the end. You have to assess the situation, know which bowlers to see off and which ones to target. When I look at the last five overs, I see 30 balls. If I can face 15 of those, I believe I can get 40 runs with the power I have."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 52 of the TATA IPL 2025 features a high-stakes encounter between Royal Challengers Bengaluru  and Chennai Super Kings  at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru. RCB, currently third on the points table with 14 points from 10 matches, aim to secure a top-two finish and solidify their playoff position. In contrast, CSK, already eliminated from playoff contention, seek to play the role of spoilers and restore some pride in the closing stages of their campaign.

RCB enters the match in formidable form, having won their last three games. Virat Kohli has been instrumental, amassing over 400 runs this season, including five half-centuries. The bowling unit, led by Josh Hazlewood and Bhuvneshwar Kumar, has been effective, particularly in the powerplay overs. Krunal Pandya's contributions with both bat and ball have further strengthened the team's performance.

CSK, on the other hand, have endured a challenging season with eight losses in ten matches. Despite the team's struggles, young talents like Dewald Brevis and Ayush Mhatre have shown promise. Veteran MS Dhoni, who averages 81.5 with a strike rate of 181.11 at the Chinnaswamy Stadium, remains a key figure in the lineup.

The pitch at Chinnaswamy has been more balanced this season, offering assistance to both batsmen and bowlers. Spinners have found success in the middle overs, and dew is expected to play a role in the second innings, potentially favouring the chasing team. Weather forecasts indicate a possibility of light rain, which could lead to brief interruptions.

Historically, CSK leads the head-to-head record with 21 wins out of 34 matches. However, RCB has won the last two encounters, including a 50-run victory earlier this season. With RCB's current momentum and CSK's desire to end on a high note, this match promises to be a compelling contest.

 

IPL 2025 Stats At Chinnaswamy Stadium:


Pitch Report | Ian Bishop & Shane Watson:
"It's always an absolute pleasure being here at this iconic venue for another match in the TATA IPL. The thing that I'm pleased about is the weather—we've got clear skies, which is a good sign after a lot of rain over the past couple of days in Bengaluru. We're standing on pitch number seven, which is right in the center of the square, so the dimensions are equidistant—64 meters both to the right and left, and 73 meters straight down the ground. This surface, pitch number seven, has produced varying scores—one match with 160, another close to 200.It's more of a prediction, But this pitch looks really nice—no doubt about that. The standout for me is that it’s a little drier than what we've seen so far in the tournament. There's not much grass cover on it. If you come down and take a close look, it's very platy and dry, and you won’t see that tennis ball bounce that’s been common here. That means the ball is going to come onto the bat a lot truer. Batters will be able to trust the bounce more, and I’d be very surprised if the team batting first doesn’t aim to set a high total. It looks like a really good surface to bat on tonight.'"

Powerplay (Overs 1-6)
RCB:- 71/0 (11.83 rpo, 8x4, 5x6) || CSK:- 58/2 (9.67 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20) 
RCB:- 69/3 (13.8 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)  || CSK:- 51/3 (10.2 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) 
 

In a pulsating contest at the Chinnaswamy, Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off a dramatic 2-run win over Chennai Super Kings, climbing to the top of the IPL 2025 table.
 RCB were powered by a sparkling 62 off 33 from Virat Kohli and a quickfire 55 from Jacob Bethell, but it was Romario Shepherd’s jaw-dropping unbeaten 53 off just 14 balls that rocketed the total to a daunting 213/5. The Caribbean all-rounder lit up the death overs, smashing four fours and six towering sixes.
CSK's chase was steered by a stunning counterattack from Ayush Mhatre, who slammed 94 off 48 balls, and Ravindra Jadeja, who remained unbeaten on 77 from 45. At 172/2 in the 17th over, the match was CSK’s to lose.But Lungi Ngidi’s triple strike and Yash Dayal’s clutch final over turned the game. With 15 needed off the last over, Dayal held his nerve yet again in a pressure finish against CSK.
 

MS Dhoni | CSK Captain:
"I think I should’ve converted a couple more shots when I went in to bat—I’ll take the blame for that. We pulled things back well in the middle overs after their good start, but Romario Shepherd was outstanding at the death.We need to work more on bowling yorkers. In high-pressure moments, yorkers or even low full tosses are tough to hit and should be our go-to. Pathirana has the pace but needs more consistency.Lap and ramp shots are useful in modern cricket, though not every batter is comfortable playing them. Jaddu can paddle but prefers hitting straight.Ayush Mhatre played a really good innings. The batting unit stepped up today, which was great to see, but the bowling wasn't quite up to the mark." 
 

Rajat Patidar | RCB Captain:
"It was a tight game, credit to their batters, but our bowlers showed great courage. Our death-over specialist delivered once again, just like last season.I backed Suyash despite it being a 50-50 call, and he came through.Lungi brings valuable experience with the white ball, and I had full faith in him. Watching those big sixes from the dugout was fun! We're not just thinking about qualification—we want to finish strong in these last 3 games. We'll celebrate a little now, but the big celebration is for after the tournament." 
 

Romario Shepherd | Player Of The Match:
"Been waiting for this chance and glad I could finish strong for the team. My power comes from a strong base and clean swing—just focused on holding my shape. DK gave us specific drills and it paid off tonight. Wasn't thinking about the score, just taking it ball by ball. Had a bad day with the ball, but credit to Dayal, Bhuvi, and Ngidi for pulling us through."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The playoff race intensifies as Gujarat Titans (GT) host Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in Match 51 of TATA IPL 2025 at the Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad. With both sides eyeing contrasting outcomes, expect a high-pressure clash tonight.

Gujarat Titans enter the contest on the back of a heavy defeat to Rajasthan Royals, but remain well-placed in the top half of the points table. A win here would take them a step closer to securing a playoff berth. Their batting unit continues to be powered by the in-form trio of Sai Sudharsan, Shubman Gill, and Jos Buttler — a top order that has consistently laid the foundation for big totals. In the bowling department, the experience and accuracy of Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna, and Rashid Khan lend GT a well-rounded edge.

For Sunrisers Hyderabad, the stakes are higher. With just a handful of games left and a slim path to the playoffs, they must win every remaining fixture to stay alive in the tournament. Despite a patchy season, SRH’s victories have been spectacular. Their 286-run total against RR is still the highest of this season, and their thrilling chase of 246 against PBKS remains the biggest successful chase in IPL 2025. Most recently, they broke their Chepauk curse by defeating CSK for the first time in Chennai — a massive morale booster coming into this clash after a week-long break.

SRH’s major challenge remains consistency — brilliance in one game has often been followed by a slump. GT, on the other hand, have been more stable across departments.

With the race for the top four narrowing, this match could shape the fate of both teams. Will GT strengthen their grip on qualification, or will SRH deliver another headline performance to keep their dream alive?



IPL Stats At Narendra Modi Stadium Since 2024:

 

Pitch Report by Nick Knight and Eoin Morgan:
"It’s the second time this surface is being used—196 played 160 in the earlier match between GT and Mumbai Indians, with GT coming out on top. The pitch looks beautiful tonight. In their previous game against the Punjab Kings, GT were out-batted by the explosive power of the opposition and couldn’t match their firepower. The shift to black soil suits GT’s style of play; it’s more aligned with their template. Tonight, there’s a lovely grass covering and an interesting subplot—Pat Cummins captained Australia to a World Cup win on this very wicket, so he’ll know how to adapt to the conditions.

In terms of the game plan, it’s all about slower balls into the wicket and introducing spin early. The idea is to be variable and take wickets at the top of the order. Both teams rely heavily on their top-order strength. The likes of Head, Sharma, Kishan, and Klaasen will be going up against Sai Sudharsan, Gill, Buttler, and Rutherford. Expect plenty of runs to rain down at Ahmedabad. The wicket has been docile, pliant, and batter-friendly. All kinds of shots have been played here, and the bowlers will have to keep up in a high-scoring battle where swords will rule the roost. We’re in for a high-scoring game for sure."

Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6)
GT:- 82/0 (13.67 rpo, 13x4, 2x6) || SRH:- 57/1 (9.50 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20)
GT:- 62/4 (12.4 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || SRH:- 47/3 (9.4 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)
 

Gujarat Titans delivered a clinical all-round performance to outclass Sunrisers Hyderabad by 38 runs in Match 51 of TATA IPL 2025 at the Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad. The win lifts GT to second place in the standings, reinforcing their playoff credentials with both bat and ball.

Put into bat first, Gujarat’s top order fired on all cylinders. Sai Sudharsan smashed a blazing 48 off 23 deliveries, setting the tempo early. Shubman Gill then took control with a captain’s knock of 76 from just 38 balls, showing his class with effortless stroke play. Jos Buttler followed suit, hammering a 64 off 37 to power GT to an imposing 224/6 — a total built on precision and power. Jaydev Unadkat was the pick of SRH’s bowlers, bagging three wickets in the death overs.

Chasing 225, Sunrisers Hyderabad needed a flying start — and Abhishek Sharma nearly gave them one. The young left-hander was the lone bright spark in the SRH innings, smashing 74 off just 41 balls with 4 fours and 6 sixes. He attacked the spinners and kept the chase alive through the middle overs. However, lack of support from the other end hurt SRH’s momentum. Once Abhishek fell in the 15th over, SRH’s hopes faded.

Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj took two wickets apiece, while Gerald Coetzee and Ishant Sharma chipped in with crucial breakthroughs. Despite a late cameo from Pat Cummins, SRH could only muster 186/6 in their 20 overs.
 

Pat Cummins (Sunrisers Hyderabad Captain):
"There were a couple of things that didn’t go our way. Our powerplay with the bat wasn’t great—I was as guilty as anyone there. We probably let them get 20–30 extra runs and maybe could’ve held on to one or two catches—I’m guilty there too. Chasing 200 would’ve looked more realistic with better execution.

They’re class batters—nothing flashy, but if you bowl bad balls, they punish you, and we probably gave away too many. That said, going for just 140 in the last 14 overs was a good effort with the ball.

Sharma batted nicely and Nitish finished well, but we left ourselves with a little too much to do, too late. We’re still clinging on to some hope. With the big auction last year, the core of this group will be around for three years, so there’s a lot to play for.

This is an amazing venue—the crowd is loud and incredibly supportive, it’s always a great place to play."
 

Shubman Gill (Gujarat Titans Captain):
"Definitely didn’t plan that—playing just 22 balls in a 20-over game wasn’t the idea. The only conversation we had was to keep playing the kind of cricket we’ve been playing so far. On a black soil pitch, hitting sixes isn’t easy, but with the way Sai, Jos, and I play, we understand how to keep the scoreboard moving.

We’ve never really had that conversation about one of us needing to stay till the end—we’re all just hungry for runs and focused on doing what’s best for the team.

Fielding is something we talk about before every match. We’ve been average in that department this season, so I’m happy with how we fielded today. Everyone is chipping in, and it’s great to have options when defending totals on these kinds of grounds.

There was a small discussion between me and the umpire—sometimes, when you’re giving your 110 percent, emotions can get involved, and that’s just part of the game."
 

Prasidh Krishna (Player of the Match):
"Honestly, wearing the Purple Cap doesn’t feel any different. I’m just happy we got this important victory—it was crucial for us. We had two long breaks, and after not winning the game post-break, this one meant a lot.

I’d say my control over length has been really good, and all the work we’ve been putting in as a team, along with the support from everyone around, has made a big difference. I’m really enjoying how the ball is coming out.

My preparation starts with what I want to do personally, and then I think about how I’d approach the specific batters I’m going to face in the game. I’ve got a lot of people around me who’ve played a lot of cricket, and I often chat with them, focus on hitting the right areas, and take it from there.

I have a red ball in my room that I’ve been playing around with, though I haven’t taken it onto the field yet. Right now, I’m just focused on this tournament—and we’ll look at what’s next after that."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It’s a clash of form and fire in Match 50 of the TATA IPL 2025, live from the Sawai Mansingh Stadium, Jaipur, as Rajasthan Royals  square off against the red-hot Mumbai Indians !

 

The Royals arrive high on emotion and adrenaline after Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the teenage sensation, carved his name in history with a breathtaking IPL century. The Jaipur crowd will be buzzing to see their local boy again, as Rajasthan aim to stack up wins and stay in the playoff hunt.

 

On the other side, Mumbai Indians are a freight train at full speed—five wins on the bounce and chasing their sixth like a side possessed. History suggests good things happen when MI gets on a streak like this—finals have followed every five-win run, bar the inaugural season. With Rohit Sharma rediscovering his mojo, Suryakumar Yadav delivering runs for fun, and Bumrah-Boult breathing fire with the ball, this team looks near-perfect. But tonight, they meet a Royals outfit brimming with belief and backed by their home crowd.

 

One team is chasing history, and the other is writing new headlines. Who prevails under the Jaipur lights? Stay tuned—this promises fireworks!

 

 

VENUE STATS:

The average score in this ground since last year's IPL is 187 batting 1st, with last match seeing the Royals chase even a 200+ score. Teams winning the toss have opted to field first in 5 of the 8 occasions and the teams chasing have come out on top on 5 of the 8 occasions as well. The pacers have dominated with 59% of the wickets at the venue in the last 2 IPL, with 41% of the wickets taken by spinners


PITCH REPORT | Ian Bishop & Matthew Hayden:

"It’s a hot evening, around 38–39°C, and I’m standing on pitch number 5. The square boundaries are 60 meters to the left, 57 to the right, and 69 meters straight down the ground. Unlike the previous game, there's less breeze today and a slightly reduced grass covering. However, the cracks on this surface are holding firm—it’s still a very good batting wicket. Expect 190 to be a par score on this hot and relatively still evening."

Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 overs) :-
MI:- 58/0 (9.67 rpo, 8x4, 2x6) ll RR:- 62/5 (10.33 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)
 

Middle Overs (7-15 overs) :-
MI:- 88/2 (9.77 rpo, 12x4, 1x6) ll RR:- 51/4 (5.67 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 overs) :-
MI:- 71/0 (14.2 rpo, 6x4, 4x6) ll RR:- 4/1 (3.43 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)


 

A dominating all-round display saw the Mumbai Indians register a thumping 100-run win over the Rajasthan Royals in Jaipur . After being put in to bat, MI piled on a massive 217/2, powered by a 116-run opening stand between Rickelton (61 off 38) and Rohit Sharma (53 off 36). But the fireworks truly exploded when Suryakumar Yadav (48* off 23) and Hardik Pandya (48* off 23) unleashed a brutal final assault, racking up 94 runs in the last 7 overs.

In the chase, the Royals were rocked early as the in-form Vaibhav Suryavanshi was dismissed for a duck in the first over, followed by Yashasvi Jaiswal in the next over. The Paltans continued their domination inside the Powerplay, dismissing half of the Rajasthan side within the Powerplay. Bumrah and Karn Sharma further dismantled the Rajasthan batting lineup, bundling out the Royals for 117. Mumbai Indians get their sixth win on the trot and move to the top of the table now, and the five-time champs are peaking at the right time.

 

 

Riyan Parag, Rajasthan Royals Skipper: "We have to give credit to the way Mumbai played. As far as our batting is concerned, it wasn't our day. 190-200 would have been ideal to chase, but then Hardik and Surya bhai at the end switched it up, we could have done a few things better, but it is how it is. We have been getting good starts, but it is up to the middle order to step up when we lose wickets in the powerplay. We have done a lot of things right, a lot of things wrong, we want to focus on the things we have done right."

 

Hardik Pandya, Mumbai Indians Skipper: "With the ball, we were spot on. Talking with SKY, we focused on playing percentage and proper cricket shots. Ro and Ryan did the same, kept the intent, targeted the gaps, and it was fantastic to watch. It’s not about giving chances, it’s about doing what the situation demands. Our bowling unit is experienced and clear with their roles, so I don’t have to worry much. We’re keeping it simple, staying humble and disciplined, and just focusing on playing good, effective cricket."

 

Ryan Rickelton is the Player of the Match

Ryan Rickelton: "It’s really special to perform in front of my family, they’re here this week, and it means a lot. Always happy to contribute to Mumbai Indians, it's such a good group, and we’re finding momentum at the right time. Batting with Rohit was incredible. We had a slow start to the tournament, but things are clicking now. The weather made us a bit unsure in the first few overs, but we settled in well and laid a solid foundation before watching Hardik and SKY take over. Adjusting to Indian conditions has been the biggest challenge. Early on, I tried changing too much, but now I’m sticking to the basics that brought me success, with a few tweaks."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the LIVE action of Match 49 in the TATA IPL 2025 – it's a royal showdown between Chennai Super Kings  and Punjab Kings  at the Anbuden. It's do-or-die for MS Dhoni’s Men in Yellow – a loss tonight will seal their fate and knock them out of playoff contention. On the other hand, Punjab Kings, led by the ever-calm Shreyas Iyer, are sitting on 5 wins from 9 games. A win today could push them firmly into the top-four conversation.

 

Punjab had the upper hand in the previous encounter between these two sides earlier this season, but with CSK playing at home – and their pride on the line – expect nothing short of a fierce contest.

 

Will the Super Kings roar back and keep their hopes alive? Or will the Kings from the North deliver another body blow?

VENUE STATS:

Teams have preferred to chase here at the venue, with the captains opting to field first in 4/5 games played here so far this season and the chasing teams winning 3 of the 5 games. 158 is the Avg score, with spinners getting 48% of the wickets alongside 52% of the pacers' wickets. Is it Spin to win in Chepauk again tonight?

 

PITCH REPORT | Graeme Swann and Aaron Finch:

"It is a 68 meter boundary on one side, and 65 meters on the other, the straight boundary is 80 meters. This wicket had been used already, and the KKR spinners wreaked havoc in that game. There's not a blade of grass on the pitch, and it's very, very dry. As the new ball starts to wear off, it's going to spin. As a batter, you've got to make the majority of runs when the ball is harder and skidding on."

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 30, 2025
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6)
CSK:- 48/3 (8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || PBKS:- 51/1 (8.5 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15)
CSK:- 86/1 (9.55 rpo, 8x4, 2x6) || PBKS:- 88/2 (9.77 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20)
CSK:- 56/6 (12.9 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || PBKS:- 55/3 (11 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)

 

Punjab Kings edged out Chennai Super Kings by 4 wickets in a high-octane clash at Chepauk, successfully chasing 191 with two balls to spare and to move to the 2nd spot on the points table. After being put in to bat first, the Men in Yellow had lost three wickets inside the Powerplay after which Sam Curran’s explosive 88 off 47 lit up CSK’s innings, but a collapse post his dismissal in the end, highlighted by Yuzvendra Chahal's 2nd Hat-Trick in the IPL, saw Punjab Kings stage a comeback and restrict CSK to 190 in 19.2 overs.

 

In the chase, Punjab Kings made the most of the Powerplay and Priyansh Arya got them off to a flyer, cracking five boundaries in his quick 23 and further Prabhsimran Singh anchored the innings with a composed 54 off 36 balls alongside skipper Shreyas Iyer whose fighting 72 off 41 balls, ensured the asking rate never spiraled out of control. Despite a few stumbles late on, Shashank Singh, Inglis and Jansen held their nerve to seal the win, helping the Kings in the North do the double over the Super Kings. And officially, Chennai Super Kings are out of contention for this year's IPL, and for the first time in their franchise history, they will miss out on the playoffs for consecutive years!

 

MS Dhoni, CSK Captain: "We finally put up a decent total, but I still feel we were 15 runs short. The partnership between Brevis and Sam was excellent and turned the game, but our dropped catches didn’t help. Losing four wickets in the penultimate over and not playing the last four balls really hurt us. Sam’s a fighter, and today’s pitch suited him better. Brevis brings momentum, energy, and power—he’s shaping up to be a real asset."

 

Shreyas Iyer is the Player of the Match

Shreyas Iyer, Punjab Kings Captain & Player of Match: "I love chasing and taking charge when there’s a big total. I’ve been putting in a lot of work in the nets, especially against the new ball, and that’s boosted my confidence. I focus on staying present and reacting to the ball, no matter where I’m playing. During the chase, we didn’t want to leave it late against their strong death bowlers, so the plan was to go hard early and back our power-hitters. Prabh and Priyansh were smart and played really well, not just slogging but applying themselves."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 14  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 14  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Tonight at the buzzing Arun Jaitley Stadium, it’s Delhi Capitals  vs Kolkata Knight Riders  — a high-stakes IPL 2025 clash brimming with drama! Delhi cling to playoff hopes, KKR fight to survive — it’s not just a match, it’s redemption on the line! The Delhi pitch plays tricks — batters feast early, but as the night deepens, spinners spin webs. KL Rahul, Delhi’s anchor with 364 runs, faces Varun Chakaravarthy’s bag of tricks. Axar Patel marshals the spin and middle order, while Mitchell Starc seeks a fiery redemption spell after a few tough outings. For KKR, Ajinkya Rahane’s classical elegance must make way for fireworks; Sunil Narine could be pushed up to trigger chaos. Dre Russ lurks, the game-changer KKR desperately need. Nostalgia sweeps through with Rishabh Pant watching from the dugout. It’s a battle of spin vs pace too — Kuldeep’s guile against Harshit Rana’s raw speed. History? KKR lead overall, but Delhi’s recent edge and home turf advantage tilt the scales. Still, T20 is a cruel game — one Russell blitz or a Narine special and the script flips! Buckle up, folks — this is a pressure-cooker waiting to blow! 


Head to Head : 


 

Pitch Report | Ian Bishop and Nick Knight:
"It feels nice and wonderful climatically out here in the middle of the Arun Jaitley Stadium. It's not too hot and it's not too cool. We are standing on Pitch Number 5 for this game—the same surface where that Super Over was played with 188 playing 188. Talking about the dimensions, it’s 63 meters to my right, 62 meters to my left, and 67 meters straight down the ground.As far as the outfield is concerned, the grass is very well cut, but more importantly, we want to understand this 22-yards. This pitch looks a bit more compact and has a bit of sheen on it, suggesting it will hold together a little more. I think this surface won't heavily bring spinners like Narine and Chakaravarthy into play. We shouldn’t be far off the score we saw against Rajasthan Royals. It's not a belter by any means, but when you compare it to the surface that was used against RCB and MI, this one looks significantly better."

Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1 - 6 Overs) : 
KKR - 79/1 (13.16 rpo, 10x4, 4x6)  ll  DC - 58/2 (9.66 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7 - 15 Overs) : 
KKR - 80/3 (8.89 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  ll  DC - 88/3 (9.77 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16 - 20 Overs) : 
KKR - 45/5 (9 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)  ll  DC - 44/4 (8.90 rpo, 4x4, 3x6) 
 

What a blockbuster at the Arun Jaitley Stadium! In a match that swung like a pendulum, Kolkata Knight Riders held their nerve to clinch a 14-run win over Delhi Capitals, defending 205 with grit, guile, and some magic from their senior pros.

Put into bat, KKR’s top order lit up the evening – Gurbaz’s electric 26 off 12, Narine’s fearless 27, and a composed 44 from young Angkrish Raghuvanshi laid the platform. Later, Rinku (36) and Russell’s cameo pushed KKR to a formidable 204/9, despite Starc’s triple strike and Axar’s control (4-0-27-2).

DC began their chase in a flash but soon stumbled. Faf du Plessis fought a lone battle, scoring a fine 62 off 45, and skipper Axar Patel smashed 43 off 23 to keep hopes alive. But Sunil Narine’s clutch spell (3/29) turned the game on its head.

Vipraj Nigam’s 38 off 19 injected late drama, but DC fell short at 190/9.

A crucial win for KKR, and Narine, leading in Rahane’s absence in the last stages of the match, proved why he’s one of IPL’s smartest minds. Capitals will rue missed chances, but take nothing away from Kolkata’s spirited fight!
 

 

 

Axar Patel | DC Captain:
"I think considering the way the wicket played, we didn’t bowl well in the powerplay and ended up conceding 15–20 extra runs. While chasing, our calculations weren’t up to the mark, and I believe the match turned on its head with two to three soft dismissals.That said, I’m pleased with how we fought back after a poor start with the ball. We managed to restrict them to a chaseable total, which was a positive takeaway. In the second innings, a couple of batters didn’t contribute much, but the others stepped up and covered that gap. We were just a couple of big hits away from securing those two points. We’ve lost a few close games this season, and in such situations, it’s important to stay calm when you're out there in the middle.When Vipraj was scoring, we still had hope. I felt that if Ashu had supported him at the other end, it could’ve reminded us of our comeback in the first game against LSG. But that’s how the game goes. Still, full credit to Vipraj—he bowled really well and played a solid knock.As for my injury, when I tried stopping the ball, my hand dragged on the surface and I scraped the skin. So whenever the bat brushed against that area, it was painful. The good part is we now have a 3–4 day break before our next match against SRH, and hopefully I’ll be fully recovered by then." 
 

Ajinkya Rahane | KKR Captain:
"I think I’ll be okay—nothing too serious. After the 13th over, when Sunil bowled those two crucial overs and picked up a couple of wickets, the game really swung in our favour. They lost quick wickets, and that was the turning point.We felt that 204 was a good total on that wicket, but in hindsight, we were probably 15 runs short. Still, as a batting unit, we were going well. And as a fielding unit, when the opposition is chasing 205, you’re always just one or two wickets away from getting control.Sunil bowled brilliantly, and that one over from Russell, plus Anukul Roy’s contribution, were all important. We went with Anukul because historically, left-arm spinners have done well here, so we backed that call.As I mentioned at the toss, it’s one game at a time for us—we don’t want to think too far ahead. That’s always been the messaging. What’s in the past is in the past; we want to take confidence from this win and move forward." 
 

Sunil Narine | Player of the Match:
"It was a total team effort. The way we started with Gurbaz, and then Angki [Raghuvanshi] and Rinku carried it forward, was excellent. I still back myself to come in and deliver for the team. Some games you start well and fade later, and in some, you begin slow but finish strong. I enjoyed all the wickets—each one is crucial, and the more you get, the better it is for the team.About that direct hit—I'm not the greatest fielder, but it was good to get a run-out. Just pick up and throw the ball as hard as you can!What keeps me going is self-pride. I always want to give the captain the option of using me in any situation. If you want to be that kind of player, you’ve got to keep up the hard work, even when there’s no training."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur braces for a high-stakes clash tonight as Rajasthan Royals (RR) lock horns with Gujarat Titans (GT) in Match 47 of TATA IPL 2025. Scheduled for a 7:30 PM start, the encounter could prove decisive for the playoff race.

Rajasthan Royals, under stand-in captain Riyan Parag, are grappling with form, having registered just two wins from nine matches. Despite Yashasvi Jaiswal’s promising performances with the bat, the side has struggled for collective consistency. The bowling unit too has lacked the edge needed to defend totals or apply pressure up front. With the playoffs slipping out of reach, RR must find inspiration quickly to keep their campaign alive.

In contrast, Gujarat Titans continue their impressive march. Led by the calm and composed Shubman Gill, GT have secured six wins in eight matches. Jos Buttler has given them flying starts, while Sai Sudharsan has been prolific in anchoring the innings, ensuring stability through the middle overs. With Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj leading the charge with the ball, Gujarat look like a well-rounded, confident unit.

Historically, GT have dominated this fixture, winning six of their seven meetings with Rajasthan. Jaipur’s pitch is expected to favor batsmen early but could offer turn as the match progresses, bringing spinners into play.

With Gujarat aiming to consolidate their top-two standing and Rajasthan desperate for survival, expect a gripping contest tonight under the lights.



IPL Stats At Sawai Mansingh Stadium since 2024:

 

Pitch Report – Daren Ganga & Matthew Hayden

"It's the third match of the season here at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. Conditions are relatively hot with a gentle breeze blowing across the ground. We are playing on pitch number 6 today. In terms of dimensions, it's 63 meters to one square boundary, 67 meters to the other, and 71 meters straight down the ground. In the two matches this season, the average first-innings score has been 177. Since 2024, we haven't seen a 200+ total at this venue.

Looking closely at the pitch, there's a perfect grass covering. The surface is hard, with a few minor cracks just starting to appear. It suggests that this may not be a 200-plus wicket, but a 180-plus score would put a team in the game. The presence of live grass means the ball should skid on nicely, and we don't expect much sideways movement for the spinners either. Given the dimensions and the pitch behaviour, power hitters will be eyeing those boundaries. Overall, a score around 180 or more would be highly competitive today."

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 28, 2025

GT :- 60/3 (12 rpo, 4x4, 3x6) ll RR :- 13/0 in 0.5 overs  (15.66 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)
 

Rajasthan Royals delivered a commanding performance at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur, overpowering Gujarat Titans by 8 wickets in a high-scoring contest of IPL 2025.

After winning the toss and opting to bowl, Rajasthan faced a stiff target as Gujarat Titans posted 209/4. Shubman Gill played a captain’s knock, smashing 84 off 50 balls, while Jos Buttler added an explosive unbeaten 50 off 26 deliveries. Sai Sudharsan contributed a quick 39 at the top. Despite the strong platform, Rajasthan’s bowlers, particularly Maheesh Theekshana and Sandeep Sharma, managed to restrict Gujarat in the closing stages.

Chasing 210, Rajasthan Royals showcased fearless batting. Yashasvi Jaiswal anchored the innings brilliantly with an unbeaten 70 off 40 balls. However, the night truly belonged to the young Vaibhav Suryavanshi. The youngster played an astonishing knock, hammering 101 off just 38 balls — registering the second-fastest century in IPL history. His innings, filled with 11 boundaries and 7 sixes, decimated the Gujarat bowling attack and turned the chase into a one-sided affair.

Captain Riyan Parag added the finishing touches with an aggressive 32* off 15 balls, guiding Rajasthan to 212/2 in just 15.5 overs.
 


 

Shubman Gill (Gujarat Titans Captain):
"They took the game away from us in the powerplay and credit to them for that. There were a couple of things we could have done better, but it’s always easier to say these things from the outside. Some chances came early our way that we couldn’t grab, and in hindsight, there are definitely areas we need to work on as a group.As for sitting out in the second innings, I felt a bit of a back spasm, and with another game just a couple of days away, the physio didn’t want to take a chance. Regardless of what happened in the previous match, whether we win or lose, we take every game as a fresh start. Our next match is at Ahmedabad, where we’ve had a good run, and hopefully we can continue that.Speaking about Vaibhav Suryavanshi, it was truly his day. His hitting was tremendous, and he made full use of the opportunity he had."
 

Riyan Parag (Rajasthan Royals Captain):
"It was incredible. We have spent two months with him and coming out here in front of all these people and against the quality bowling attack that GT had, it's just something you can’t express in words.We changed things a bit since the last game. We just thought of finishing off games a little earlier. We wanted to show more intent in the middle overs. Whenever a new batter walks in, can the other batter play some shots and back him? We wanted to try these things and it worked brilliantly tonight for us.You can learn almost every day watching the IPL. You can see how RCB runs in the field, you can watch how Surya bhaiya finishes games for MI. I think you just need to take notes from everyone and then try to execute the same when you get the chance.This win will be a big boost for us. We badly needed to win in a comprehensive style. It was a one-sided win, which makes me a little more happy. Now we need to take it one game at a time. We’ll wait and see what kind of wicket we get here for the next game and take it from there."

Vaibhav Suryavanshi (Player of the Match):
"I am feeling very good. Scoring my first hundred in the IPL, and that too in just my third innings, feels special. All the practice that I have put in over the last four to five months has finally paid off. I don't look at the bowlers too much on the ground; I just try to play every ball on its merit. I love batting with him. He keeps talking positively and constantly encourages me to do well. It feels like a dream to score a century in the IPL. Like I said, I have worked hard in the last few months, and it has all come together beautifully. No, I don't fear anything. I don’t think too much; I just want to stay focused on my game.

Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 6  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Tonight, the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi will witness a high-stakes IPL 2025 clash as Delhi Capitals (DC) take on Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). Both teams are in the top three of the points table, making this encounter crucial for playoff positioning.DC, led by KL Rahul, have been consistent this season, boasting a balanced side with both experienced and young talents. Their bowling attack, featuring Mitchell Starc and Kuldeep Yadav, has been particularly effective on home turf.

RCB, under the captaincy of Rajat Patidar, have shown resilience, with Virat Kohli and Devdutt Padikkal anchoring the batting lineup. Their pace attack, including Josh Hazlewood and Bhuvneshwar Kumar, will be key on Delhi's batting-friendly pitch.The head-to-head record favors RCB, with 19 wins out of 32 matches against DC. However, DC's recent form and home advantage could tilt the balance.Expect a high-scoring thriller, with both teams eager to secure a top-two finish. The team that handles the pressure better and executes their plans efficiently will likely emerge victorious.
 

 

Pitch Report – Graeme Swann & Aaron Finch 

"Good news for bowlers—on one side, the boundary is 66 meters.But there’s some bad news too—the other side is only 58 meters.It’s a 71-meter hit straight down the ground, with a big pocket of 75 meters toward deep midwicket.Whether these dimensions come into play depends largely on the pitch.Whenever you come to Delhi, you’re never quite sure what you’ll get. Sometimes it’s a high-scoring belter, but today we’ve got a very dry surface.You can see how exposed the pitch is—not much live grass at all.In the previous match against Mumbai Indians, it was a low-scoring game. There was 4.1 degrees of turn here compared to 1.7 degrees in the other match.For me, it’s important to get your spinners into the game early.There’s only a tiny tinge of grass, so there won’t be much assistance for the fast bowlers even though it might look green at first glance. It’s going to be a pretty good wicket for the spinners.If you’re batting, you probably want to score your runs early against the new ball, before it starts turning."



Venue Stats:

Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:

DC:- 52/2 (8.67 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) ll RCB:- 35/3 (5.83 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (overs 16-20) :-
DC:- 54/4 (10.8 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) ll RCB:- 51/1 (10.2 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) 
 

Royal Challengers Bengaluru romped to a clinical 6-wicket victory over Delhi Capitals, chasing down 163 with 9 balls to spare at a packed stadium.
It was Krunal Pandya who led the charge with a masterful 73* off 47 balls, blending composure with calculated aggression, as RCB recovered from early stutters in the powerplay. Tim David, playing the finisher’s role to perfection, smashed an unbeaten 19 off just 5 deliveries to close the game in emphatic fashion.

Earlier, Delhi Capitals posted 162/8 after flashes of brilliance from Abishek Porel (28 off 11) and Tristan Stubbs (34 off 18). However, they failed to convert quick starts into substantial partnerships. Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Josh Hazlewood starred with the ball, applying pressure at crucial moments.Virat Kohli anchored RCB’s chase with a gritty 51 off 47 before falling late, but Krunal took charge, smashing five fours and four sixes to dominate the middle overs. Mukesh Kumar’s expensive spell undid DC’s hopes of a comeback.With this win, RCB continued their momentum surge, showcasing depth, power, and poise in the chase under pressure. 



 

Axar Patel | Delhi Capitals Captain:
"I think we were 10–15 runs short in the end.In the first innings, it was tough to bat—the pitch was two-paced—but dew made batting easier later on in the second innings.We also haven’t been able to convert tough chances into wickets, and that's something we definitely need to work on.The intent was there, but the wicket wasn’t easy.We lost wickets every time we tried to accelerate, and if a batter had stayed till the end, it could have made a big difference.Had we managed just 10–15 more runs, I feel we could have won the match.No specific reason—KL was batting well, and I wanted him at No. 4.We were trying to maximize the left-right combination and target the short boundary, which was part of the plan." 

 

Rajat Patidar | Royal Challengers Bengaluru Captain: 
"It was a total team performance today.The way the bowlers executed their plans was nice to see.As I mentioned earlier, we are not focusing on venues—our only focus is on playing good cricket.Chasing gives you clarity—you get a good read on the wicket, the bowling attack, and the required score.It was a gettable target, and full credit goes to the bowlers for setting it up.We were very clear about our approach while chasing.It feels great to lead RCB.With so many great players around, it’s a fantastic opportunity for me to learn and grow."
 

Krunal Pandya | Player of the Match:
"It’s always satisfying when the hard work behind the scenes pays off and you get the result you’re looking for.My role was very clear—if we lost early wickets, I had to stitch a partnership.With Jitesh and David capable of taking down the bowling later, my job was to stabilize and set the platform. I’m glad I was able to fulfill that role today.When Virat is at the other end, things become easier.A lot of credit goes to him—he kept backing me, encouraging me to find the gaps and keep the scoreboard ticking.I have always tried to be economical—this is my 10th season now.This year, I’ve worked a lot on my bowling—varying my pace, understanding batters’ strengths, and using that to stay one step ahead."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
This afternoon, the Wankhede Stadium sets the stage for a high-stakes IPL 2025 clash between Mumbai Indians (MI) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). Both teams are locked at 10 points from nine matches, making this encounter pivotal in the playoff race.

MI, under Hardik Pandya's leadership, have turned their season around with four consecutive wins. The resurgence of Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav has bolstered their batting lineup, while the bowling attack, spearheaded by Jasprit Bumrah, has been formidable.LSG, captained by Rishabh Pant, have had a mixed season. Despite a strong head-to-head record against MI, winning six out of seven encounters, they face challenges with Pant's form and recent inconsistencies.

The Wankhede pitch is known for its batting-friendly nature, with short boundaries favouring big hitters. However, early in the match, pacers might find some assistance, making the toss crucial. Teams winning the toss might prefer to field first, considering the dew factor in the evening. With both teams vying for a spot in the top four, expect a thrilling contest. MI's current momentum and home advantage could give them the edge, but LSG's past dominance can't be overlooked. 


Pitch Report – Ian Bishop & Eoin Morgan |

"It’s hot and humid here at Wankhede—33 degrees Celsius, but it feels closer to 38 or even 40 degrees under this afternoon sun.It’s going to be a special day, with over 19,000 school kids filling the stands, creating a fantastic atmosphere.As for the pitch, we’re standing on the center strip—it’s 63 meters either side and 73 meters straight down the ground.In day games at Wankhede historically, it’s been evenly split—four wins batting first, four wins chasing.Looking closely at the surface, there’s a magnificent covering of grass on top. But if you get down and feel it, underneath, the surface is quite dry.There’s a bit of bristle when you touch it, which suggests the ball might hold up slightly early on.As the game progresses, there’s a chance the ball could slow up just a little bit.If I were to win the toss today, I would prefer to chase—a big call given the intense heat, but with the uncertainty of how the surface might behave later, it could actually get better for batting as the game goes on."

Death Overs (Overs 16-20) :-

Mumbai Indians flexed their muscles at Wankhede, brushing aside Lucknow Super Giants by 53 runs in a one-sided affair. Powered by blistering fifties from Ryan Rickelton (58 off 32) and Suryakumar Yadav (54 off 28), MI piled up a mammoth 215/7 after being sent in. Cameos from Naman Dhir (25* off 11) and Corbin Bosch (20 off 10) provided the finishing touches as MI smashed 11 sixes across the innings.

In reply, Lucknow’s chase never really took off. Jasprit Bumrah was at his devastating best, picking up 4/22, including the prized scalps of Markram, Miller, and Samad. Trent Boult, relentless as ever, chipped in with a tidy 3/20. Despite a brief spark from Ayush Badoni (35 off 22) and Nicholas Pooran’s quickfire 27, LSG kept losing wickets in clusters, folding for 161 in the final over.

With this thumping win, Mumbai Indians stamped their authority yet again, while Lucknow were left to rue another top-order failure. Bumrah’s brilliance, SKY’s swagger, and a polished team effort pushed MI firmly into the top half of the table — and reminded the rest of the pack who still rules the Wankhede fortress.



 

Rishabh Pant | Lucknow Super Giants Captain:
"I feel it was the right decision for us today.Most of the time, we back our batting because that’s how this tournament has unfolded—it’s generally our batting that gives us the best chance.Yes, we want to provide good conditions for our bowlers to defend totals, but today just wasn’t our day.Credit to the opposition for playing better cricket.Thankfully, we have a break at the right time to reassess and figure things out.We’re keeping it very simple. Not overthinking. In tough times, it’s easy for players to start questioning themselves, and we don’t want that mindset creeping in.It’s always a team game. Yes, one player can make a difference, but collective performance is crucial.It was great to see Mayank back from injury. First game back, and he’s already starting to find his rhythm. Hopefully, he’ll get even better and stronger moving forward." 


Hardik Pandya | Mumbai Indians Captain:
"Absolutely. Momentum is crucial, and the way we are carrying it forward, with everyone clicking together, is fantastic.The energy created by the kids in the crowd today was special. We wanted to perform for them as much as for ourselves.Everyone kept taking their chances. Even after losing a couple of wickets late, Bosch smacked a few sixes, Naman contributed, and before that, Surya played an unbelievable innings.Everyone is chipping in—whether it's Ryan, Bosch, Naman, Surya, or myself—and that’s what good teams are built on.Whenever required, I’m ready to bowl myself. But today, I felt it was the right time to bring Bosch in and let him do what he does best.This is a very tough competition. We’re mindful of not getting carried away.As a group, we’ll continue to focus on playing good cricket without worrying too much about what’s coming next."

 

Will Jacks | Player of the Match:
"I'll always see myself as a batter who bowls, but when I bowl well, it’s a bonus for the team and for me.I work very hard on my bowling. I know I’m considered a part-timer, but I believe I can do the job when needed and there's still room for improvement.We knew how important Pooran and Pant were at that stage.As an off-spinner against left-handers, you’re always looking for an opportunity. Once I got Pooran, there was a sense of relief and we knew we had the game in control.I really enjoy bowling to left-handers—it brings more chances my way.I’ve loved my time here. Everyone has been so welcoming and given me a lot of confidence.As a team, we are now hitting the right areas, but there’s still more work to do, and we’re excited for the upcoming games.Jasprit is an incredible bowler. I’ve had the displeasure of facing him in the nets—and trust me, it's not enjoyable!I’m just grateful he’s in my team. He’s incredibly skillful and amazing to watch."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Eden Gardens is all set to roar as Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) square off against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 44 of TATA IPL 2025. Both teams come into this contest with very different trajectories — PBKS are comfortably placed at fifth with five wins in eight games, while KKR, with just three victories, are fighting to stay in contention.

Punjab Kings have been a consistently strong unit this season, led by some explosive starts — their average powerplay score of 60 is the highest among all teams. Shreyas Iyer has been a rock at the top for PBKS, scoring 263 runs at an average of 43.8, peppered with 20 maximums, and providing the team much-needed stability and aggression.

KKR, despite a mixed season, boast the best boundary percentage in the powerplay at 80.9%, showing they have the firepower to dominate early. Ajinkya Rahane has been a key figure, amassing 271 runs at an average of 38.7, playing the anchor’s role effectively.

History between these two sides has been nothing short of dramatic. PBKS chased down a record total of 262 against KKR last season, but in stark contrast, they also defended the lowest total ever — just 111 — against the same opposition. With both teams carrying that backdrop into this clash, another memorable encounter could be on the cards.

With playoff dreams on the line and pride at stake, expect fireworks, intensity, and maybe even another chapter in their record-breaking rivalry at Eden Gardens tonight.



IPL Stats at Eden Gardens Since 2024:
 
 

Pitch Report – Graeme Swann & Matthew Hayden | Eden Gardens

"We’re here in the middle of Eden Gardens, my favorite ground in India by a mile!Talking about dimensions: from a bowler’s point of view, they’re not that big—62 meters to my right, 64 meters to my left, and 75 meters straight down the ground.The real challenge for bowlers is the small pockets—just 57 and 56 meters—making it tough for spinners to defend boundaries.That said, this pitch looks very good. It’s a beautiful evening here, but there's also a strong breeze blowing straight down the ground, which could make bowling even trickier.What’s fascinating about this pitch is that there are quite a few bare patches despite a little grass cover. As a bowler, you'd want to target those rough areas to get some purchase.From what we've seen across matches here, this has been a very dry wicket.This is the third time this track is being used, and it’s been not easy to score on each time.Spinners from both sides could wreak havoc today. One end looks particularly bare and rough compared to the other, making hard lengths tricky for batters.Bottom line: if you want to score runs, you’ll have to cash in against the fast bowlers—because the spinners could really dominate tonight."
